ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
0=18-44 years; 2=45-54 years; 3=55-64 years; 4=65 years or older

ElementDescription: What is the patient's body-mass index (BMI) category?
Notes: 0=Normal (lower than 25.0 kg/m2); 1=Overweight (25-29.9 kg/m2); 3=Obese (30 kg/m2 or higher)

ElementDescription: What is the patient's waist circumference?
Notes: Women: 0=Less than 80 cm (31 inches); 3=80-88cm (31-35 inches); 4=More than 88 cm (35+ inches) / Men 0=Less than 94 cm (37 inches); 3=94-102 cm (37-40 inches); 4=More than 102 cm (40+ inches)

ElementDescription: Is the patient physically active for more than 30 minutes every day? This includes physical activity during work, leisure, or regular daily routine.
How often does the patient eat vegetables and fruits?
Has the patient ever taken medications for high blood pressure on a regular basis?
Has your patient ever been found to have high blood glucose (e.g. in a health examination, during an illness, during pregnancy)?
Have any members of your patient's immediate family or other relatives (only blood relatives) been diagnosed with diabetes (type 1 or type 2)?
Notes: 0=No; 3=Yes; grandparent, aunt, uncle, or first cousin; 5=Yes: parent, brother, sister, or own child
0 = eat vegetables, fruit, berries, or dark/whole wheat bread daily; 1 = no vegetables, fruit, berries, or dark/whole wheat bread daily
